title: 2 Euro (First Flight from Malta)

composition.text: Bimetallic: nickel brass clad nickel centre in copper-nickel ring

obverse.description: The coin commemorates an important milestone in Maltese aviation history — the 100 years since the first flight from Malta. It was on 13 February 1915 that Captain Kilmer took off from the Grand Harbour on a seaplane that was carried by HMS Ark Royal. The plane landed in the harbour after a 55-minute flight. The coin depicts Captain Kilmer’s seaplane with Senglea Point, a prominent feature in the Grand Harbour, in the background. At the top the inscription ‘FIRST FLIGHT FROM MALTA’ in semi-circle. At the right the years ‘1915-2015’. At the bottom left the inscription ‘100TH ANNIVERSARY’ and at the bottom the initials of the designer ‘NGB’ (Noel Galea Bason). The coin’s outer ring bears the 12 stars of the European Union.
obverse.lettering:
FIRST FLIGHT FROM MALTA 1915 - 2015
100TH
ANNIVERSARY
NGB

reverse.description: A map, next to the face value, shows the European continent without borders.

commemorated_topic: 100th Anniversary of First Flight from Malta
comments: The coin commemorates an important milestone in Maltese aviation history — the 100 years since the first flight from Malta. It was on 13 February 1915 that Captain Kilmer took off from the Grand Harbour on a seaplane that was carried by HMS Ark Royal. The plane landed in the harbour after a 55-minute flight. The coin depicts Captain Kilmer’s seaplane with Senglea Point, a prominent feature in the Grand Harbour, in the background.

edge.description: Reeded with inscription: six times a "2" and two Maltese crosses, alternately upright and inverted
